_header: Fare well my joy my comfort and solace
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 1098.
_description: A ‘Farewell’ anaphora to his mistress — one stanza rhyme royal

Bod120.First Lines:
fayre wele my Ioye my comfort and solacefayre wele the floure
                    fayrest of vente…
Bod120.Last Lines:
…Fayre wele my hertes lyve & my plesauncefayre wele
                    disport & fayre wele dalyance
Bod120.Attributed Title:
Aue maria (f. 95); It is to me of Ioy the esperance (f. 95, before
                    first line)
Bod120.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 207.
